meanings.definition: The act of firing a cannon.
meanings.sent1: The cannoning at the historical reenactment was very loud.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers practiced their cannoning skills for the upcoming battle.
meanings.sent3: The cannoning startled the birds in the nearby trees.
meanings.sent4: The cannoning echoed through the valley like thunder.
meanings.sent5: The cannoning left a cloud of smoke hanging in the air.

meanings.definition: The act of colliding forcefully with something.
meanings.sent1: The cannoning of the two cars resulted in a loud crash.
meanings.sent2: The cannoning of the waves against the rocks could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent3: The cannoning of the soccer balls against the goalposts was music to the players' ears.
meanings.sent4: The cannoning of ideas in the meeting led to a creative breakthrough.
meanings.sent5: The cannoning of the hammer against the nail echoed in the workshop.

meanings.definition: The act of moving swiftly and forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The cannoning of the race cars around the track thrilled the spectators.
meanings.sent2: The cannoning of the wind through the trees created a soothing sound.
meanings.sent3: The cannoning of the roller coaster made everyone scream with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The cannoning of the waterfall down the cliff was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The cannoning of the train through the tunnel shook the ground beneath our feet.
